alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:32PM EDT until June 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR EASTERN CUMBERLAND...GOOCHLAND...NORTHWESTERN HANOVER AND NORTHERN POWHATAN COUNTIES... At 532 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ladysmith to Montpelier to near Oilville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Wyndham around 550 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Crozier, Rock Castle, Vontay, Maidens, Three Square, Irwin, Johnsons Springs, Gilman, Fine Creek Mills and Michaux. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
